sentences.sentence: Letters to the editor: our readers share their views.
Please send your letters toletters@independent.co.ukI really feel that an election should be called.

AllLiz Trussand her chancellor are doing is lining the pockets of the rich.At a time when most of the country is worrying about how to pay their bills and prices are soaring, they aregiving money to the wealthiest people in the country- who are not struggling to pay any bills, who already have enough perks, and who never have to worry where the next penny is coming from.We did not elect this so-called prime minister.
It seems to be a government for the rich 5 per cent of the population and not the 95 per cent.

She has made us a bigger laughing stock in front of the rest of the world than Boris Johnson ever did.A vote is definitely needed to get her out before she does any more damage, and causes more suffering to those hardest hit bythe rises in the cost of living.Maureen PiffAddress suppliedOn the brinkClearly, this government, with its mini-Budget, has made it clear thatthe rich are favouredand the poor ignored.There has been some help withcapping of energy charges, so those who barely could afford last year's bill know it will only double next year!
Cash payments will have to be repaid, which is another problem for the poor.Some political commentators have expressed surprise that the poor have been ignored.
Do not be surprised, the government doesn't care.
This is a class war.Should we protest?

The law has taken away our right to protest, as illustrated bypeople being arrestedfor displaying perfectly reasonable placards seeking a republic.Should we strike?The government has already floated ideasabout taking away the fundamental right of people to withhold their labour.We are on the brink of fascism.
These are dangerous times.Robert MurrayNottinghamChurch and stateStephen Evans makes a good casefor the separation of the church and state.
How can it be that the top job in the country comes with a "Catholics need not apply" condition?Why is it that Church of England bishops are still occupying seats in theHouse of Lords?
But we need to go further.

Why we are not only allowing, but actively funding schools, where religious segregation is allowed and doctrine is taught?Most of the conflicts around the world have an element of religious intolerance, with religion used as a means to stir up unrest.Lastly, I can't help wondering what the response of the DUP and their supporters would be if we were to have a Catholic king.G ForwardStirlingNot fairTo be fair, this country needs to choose who is going to be the next prime minister - and notaround 170,000 Conservative Party members.

It's not democratic.To keep up to speed with all the latest opinions and comment, sign up to our free weekly Voices Dispatches newsletter byclicking hereOur country needs to believe in fairness - and practice what we preach.Rajendra VaghelaAddress suppliedNuclear weaponsPutin's threat to use nuclear weaponsinUkraineis based on the premise that there will be no retaliation from a country that no longer has nuclear weapons.However, it needs to be said that any country with access to nuclear fuel has the wherewithal to produce “dirty bombs” and only needs the means to deliver such weapons to retaliate effectively.
Only a deranged fool would deny that Ukraine has the capacity to do both.David SmithTaunton

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: Letters to the editor: our readers share their views. Please send your letters toletters@independent.co.ukI really feel that an election should be called. AllLiz Trussand her chancellor are doing is lining the pockets of the rich.At a time when most of the country is worrying about how to pay their bills and prices are soaring, they aregiving money to the wealthiest people in the country– who are not struggling to pay any bills, who already have enough perks, and who never have to worry where the next penny is coming from.We did not elect this so-called prime minister. It seems to be a government for the rich 5 per cent of the population and not the 95 per cent. She has made us a bigger laughing stock in front of the rest of the world than Boris Johnson ever did.A vote is definitely needed to get her out before she does any more damage, and causes more suffering to those hardest hit bythe rises in the cost of living.Maureen PiffAddress suppliedOn the brinkClearly, this government, with its mini-Budget, has made it clear thatthe rich are favouredand the poor ignored.There has been some help withcapping of energy charges, so those who barely could afford last year’s bill know it will only double next year! Cash payments will have to be repaid, which is another problem for the poor.Some political commentators have expressed surprise that the poor have been ignored. Do not be surprised, the government doesn’t care. This is a class war.Should we protest? The law has taken away our right to protest, as illustrated bypeople being arrestedfor displaying perfectly reasonable placards seeking a republic.Should we strike?The government has already floated ideasabout taking away the fundamental right of people to withhold their labour.We are on the brink of fascism. These are dangerous times.Robert MurrayNottinghamChurch and stateStephen Evans makes a good casefor the separation of the church and state. How can it be that the top job in the country comes with a "Catholics need not apply" condition?Why is it that Church of England bishops are still occupying seats in theHouse of Lords? But we need to go further. Why we are not only allowing, but actively funding schools, where religious segregation is allowed and doctrine is taught?Most of the conflicts around the world have an element of religious intolerance, with religion used as a means to stir up unrest.Lastly, I can’t help wondering what the response of the DUP and their supporters would be if we were to have a Catholic king.G ForwardStirlingNot fairTo be fair, this country needs to choose who is going to be the next prime minister – and notaround 170,000 Conservative Party members.  It’s not democratic.To keep up to speed with all the latest opinions and comment, sign up to our free weekly Voices Dispatches newsletter byclicking hereOur country needs to believe in fairness – and practice what we preach.Rajendra VaghelaAddress suppliedNuclear weaponsPutin’s threat to use nuclear weaponsinUkraineis based on the premise that there will be no retaliation from a country that no longer has nuclear weapons.However, it needs to be said that any country with access to nuclear fuel has the wherewithal to produce “dirty bombs” and only needs the means to deliver such weapons to retaliate effectively. Only a deranged fool would deny that Ukraine has the capacity to do both.David SmithTaunton
